comment.text: Shrimp tacos.  Nice big shrimp.  And the salad. I like the dressing and all the different veggies.   Chips and guac  cool to go in the summer on rooftop also.

I recently visited Atlanta with my husband and we wanted to grab a bite and some drinks around where we were staying and so we passed by Azotea and we loved it! The food was overall really great, and even though it started to rain a bit by our area we managed to get some help to move out chairs and table closer to not get soaked! The service was great, our server was very attentive of us and she gave us some good recommendations! The ambiance was overall great too, with a variety of  music and delicious drinks! Hope to visit again some day!

Really stunning views from this location, good photo opportunities. Really good balcony to enjoy the weekend at Atlantic station.

Didn't try any drinks, tryna lose some weight right now. But the Guavamole was ok, it's a good appetizer. I was disappointed in the $25 redfish, yea they got me on that one! I'd avoid it, I didn't really taste much of a difference between that and tilapia. But overall good spot check it out if you have time.

Just OK. My husband and I decided to stop by for an early dinner and we thought it was a decent restaurant but nothing extraordinary.

Los Guidry's Thoughts and Recommendations:
- Guacamole is good! The ingredients were fresh and the portion was decent. The serrano pepper made me a little nervous since I can't do spicy but it was only a little kick. 
- Tacos were ok. We ordered the Chicken al Carbon and the Shrimp a la Plancha and thought they were fine. Nothing really special about them to be honest. And I get it, tacos are on every menu but not everyone can make authentic delicious tacos and that's ok.
- Service was rough. We had to ask for our drinks multiple times and waited 20 minutes to get them. Just overall slow and as if the staff was in no rush to help customers.

The restaurant had a nice ambiance and cool rooftop so the vibe is right. But when it comes to the food and service I'm not quite sure this place is it.

Overall 4/5: Very chill hangout spot. We stopped in for some light snacks and drinks.

Drinks 4/5: We got frozen margaritas, very good. 

Food 4/5: We had a couple appetizers just to snack on while we had drinks and they were all good. We got the queso fundido, queso dip, guacamole, and shrimp cocktail. The shrimp cocktail was my favorite. So refreshing and light. Great flavor on it. The sauce that came with the shrimp cocktail was so good, we asked for some more on the side to eat with our other snacks. Delicious 

Service 4/5: Polite and friendly bartender. Very patient and attentive. 

Vibe 4/5: Good music, cute place. We sat on the roof at the bar, very peaceful at sunset. 

Definitely will be back to try their other food! 

Thank you, Azotea Cantina!

I've had Azotea bookmarked for quite some time now and I finally checked them out last night for dinner on the rooftop. I can see myself coming back during the warmer months to hang out and grab drinks/a couple of tacos. Speaking of tacos I ordered the Baja fish tacos and my date had the chicken tacos. I thought my tacos were pretty good not spectacular, but good. I was a little disappointed that there weren't any quesadillas on the menu, but overall I would go back just to hang out.

Stopped in for a quick bite. This is my first visit to Atlanta And Azotea is about a 7 min walk from my hotel. I
I ordered the Ahi Tuna Tostadas Absolutely amazing. The flavor is perfectly balanced, the ahi is fresh and it's filling if you want to have it as a meal. It's served over 3 tostadas and it's perfect as a shared plate as well. 
I also ordered some carnita and carne asada tacos! Delicious!! I ended up taking half of the food home .. I got full fast. 
The ambiance was pretty awesome and the service was great. Everyone was so friendly . I'll definitely be going back.

We found this spot after ice skating at Atlantic Station, and were pleasantly surprised. We were seated immediately and it did not take long for our waiter to greet us. Upon ordering cocktails and an appetizer, it came out within 5 min (if not less). The same with our entrees. This was one of the best dining services I have experienced in Atlanta, especially because of the Service Manager, Donovan Rhodes. A must try!

The first time I came to this establishment I met some friends on the rooftop. I ordered the crispy chicken tacos. They were juicy and delicious. So often fried chicken is over cooked and dry. Not these! The portion was very filling. The drinks were also well balanced. The service wasn't the best but the young man was friendly yet forgetful. I joined the party late so everyone had already eaten and cashed out. It took a very long time for the server to return with my bill. When I received my bill everything looked correct and I handed over my card. When he returned, he handed me a much higher bill with a copy to sign. When I pointed out the difference the server apologized and said he swiped my card on someone else's bill. He went back to fix it which took a while as well. When he returned he assured me it was fixed but claimed he couldn't get me a receipt.
The DJ was a vibe and folks actually got up and danced. This was a chill Sunday evening.

My second time patronizing this establishment was today (also Sunday). I sat on the downstairs patio with my kid. I ordered the queso which came out watery and room temperature. We both thought it was gross and pushed it to the side. I also tried an organic reposado margarita which was good. I decided after the disappointing queso I would play it safe and order the chicken tacos again. Unfortunately this time the tacos weren't great and the portion was skimpy. I took a picture because I couldn't believe how small the chicken portions were this time around. I was hungry and I am not one to complain but I was honest with the server when asked how everything was. She was nice and unapologetic. She did not offer to have a manager come over nor did she offer to remove the uneaten queso & chips from the bill. Instead she noted that's how the queso always is. No comment was made regarding my chicken tacos. 

The ambiance was upbeat with salsa music playing. Not sure if I'll go back.

photos.caption: A chicken nugget disguised in a taco

comment.text: Great atmosphere and wonderful service. I was only there for drinks but the food looked delicious. Shout out to Donovan and the bar staff for "creating" my drink and providing a really fun experience.

Drinks are good here and they have cute names! It's the NBA playoffs, so I was thankful that our table was close enough to the bar so I could watch the games without straining. :D

We tried the guacamole with crispy pork and though the guac was spot with flavor and texture, I wish the pork was cut up and actually mixed in. The pieces of perfectly crispy pork were positioned around the guac mound, so you had to scoop them separately. 

The shrimp tacos were by far the best taco we tried. Some places serve whole shrimp in the tortilla, but I was pleasantly surprised that Azotea cuts the shrimp -it's easier to eat this way. The shrimp was seasoned perfectly and the cheese + sauce took it over the top for me. Would absolutely order those again! 
My friend had the steak/asada tacos and she thought they were great too!

The only thing I didn't like from our whole order was the "suadero" tacos. That's because they were unlike any other suadero I've had before. Disclaimer: because it's centrally located in Atlantic Station and quite popular in the evenings, it can get really loud. Be prepared to speak a bit louder to be heard by others in your dining party.

Overall, this was a nice spot for afterwork dinner and drinks - would recommend!

Service was 1000/10! The food, the drinks,  and ambiance was everything and more. We had a party of four and we got sat quickly and got the most friendly service. We were definitely well taken care of thanks to Jenny and Donavon!!! 
Definitely coming back!

I came here for the first time for lunch and it was delicious! I ordered the shrimp tacos and they were so flavorful! It was the perfect size with the perfect amount of fillings. The chips and queso was also very good. The queso stayed warm throughout our meal which I appreciated. The chips were also warm and great consistency. My friend ordered the steak and fries tacos. She was t the biggest fan. Overall a great experience and I will definitely be back!

Passes the vibe check! In Atlanta Station where Rosa's restaurant once stood is now Azotea Cantina. I visited this restaurant on a Friday night with a group to celebrate our friend's birthday celebration. You must be 21 to proceed to the upstairs rooftop. The DJ was jamming  and the food and drinks were flowing. Our waiter, Tamara, did a great job with providing attentive and friendly service to our large party of 12. Prior to ordering we were told in advance that there would be one check which gave us a chance to plan in advance on how to handle that process before folks started feeling the effects of their cocktails...lol. I only eat hard shell tacos and that's not an option provided. I enjoyed the presentation and taste of my meal--baby back ribs (Costilla de Puerco) with rice and beans. The menu was diverse and met the dietary needs of our large group which ranged from carnivores to pescatarians. Parking is plentiful in the underground parking garage. Stairwell 3 will put you close to the restaurant.

If I could give this place more than five stars I would. This is one of the best restaurants Atlantic Station could have added. The ambience, the food, the service.. was AMAZING! Our bartender for the evening was Khalea! She was amazing! Make sure you get her to make your drinks and be sure to tip her 

So we sat upstairs ( yes they have an upstairs and it is huge). We decided to sit at the bar. I decided to order guacamole !! It was soooo good and the Carne Asada Tacos!! They were amazing. For drinks we had the blackberry Margarita. It was sweet but be careful, the alcohol sneaks up on you lol. We went on a Thursday it was chill ( like I like it) Khalea mentioned the crowds come in on Fridays and Saturdays. There are fans on the patios, great scenery, be sure to add this place to your list !!

I visited two days after Thanksgiving (Saturday) and I was traveling alone. I was able to score a seat at the bar for myself and shopping bags while the Michigan game aired. The service I received was "okay." No one went out of their way to ensure this was a memorable visit at all. I watched as a bartender received shots and displayed an annoyed look at other patrons. I did enjoy my drink and the shrimp on the tacos I ordered but that was it. The flour tortilla was not tasty at all. After experiencing this establishment for myself without reading reviews, I may have to start reading them before spending my hard earned cash.

Came here for dinner after a show, and despite the place being busy we got seated in a couple of minutes.

Our waitress was great, really upbeat and good about getting us drinks, giving us time to look over the menu, and checking in on us, and we started off with the queso appetizer. Not a huge a queso fan, but this one was really good; they added some spices and little onion etc to kick it up a notch, and I also really liked the tortilla chips.

You can't mix and match tacos. You get 3 of a kind, but we split the baja fish and portobello Both types were good but neither were amazing, and I would have found either option a little small without some kind of side or app. I liked the amount of kick but they do deserve a spicy warning.

We came on a Saturday afternoon. It was crowded, but we were able to be seated upstairs by the bar. The high top tables are placed in a weird area that gets all the foot traffic to the open patio area on the rooftop. Our sever was also the main bartender. She did her best with service. The drinks were outstanding! I ordered pork tacos and my husband got a quesadilla. We also got the queso. All of this food was soooo good. They missed the fifth star because of the fries on the tacos. I found them to be strange and unnecessary. The fries were also old and stale. Overall, it was a good experience minus the fries and weird placement of the chairs/tables upstairs near the bar.

My server was Jalen and he was very attentive. It was my first time visiting. I ordered the salad with grilled shrimp. It took the kitchen over 30 mins to deliver our food and when it arrived the shrimp was cold. The restaurant offered us a $2 discount but the additional shrimp was $6. After paying I also noticed that the menu prices were not the same as what is actually rung up for customers, prices were off by $1-$2.

The experience with our server was great, the salad was good (minus the cold shrimp) but overall would have liked better service from the kitchen with timing and accurate prices on the menu.
Vibe was good and it got packed really quick.  Travis could have been seasoned a little better, but it's all good.

Great new addition to the restaurants in Atlantic Station I have been twice and gotten the fish tacos both times I recommend this dish it's done very well and I got the brussels sprouts with the pork on the side they were delicious and I would order this exact same thing again looking forward to coming here more often! Service was great our waitress is very nice and parking is a breeze with two hours of free parking in the deck.

Azotea Cantina is great option for those looking for a quick taco fix. I sometimes have to travel to Atlanta for work and the home office is right within Atlantic Station. I've been here about four times and finally snapped a few photos for a proper review.

On my most recent visit (3/1/22) I took several work colleagues out to lunch. I kept it simple and ordered the fish tacos. How is the food? It's fine and nothing special. It hits the spot to be sure. It's *almost* impossible to have a bad taco in my humble opinion.

I suppose I would equate it to eating McDonalds in Europe. It's a taste of home but not really. What am I talking about? The best fish tacos in the known world are in Mexico and Southern California. Therefore everyone is playing for second place including Azotea Cantina. I get the taste of home which comforts me if not blowing my socks off. A decent taco (which these are) is far better than NO taco at all.

YMMV

Went there for lunch on Labor Day so there was a 30-45 minute wait. We left and received a text once our table was ready, and when we went back we got seated right away. It was clear that they were short staffed but they were doing their best with the staff that was there. Our waiter was friendly and we ordered everything right away. Our food came out before our drinks, the waiter apologized and explained they were short staffed and then brought our drinks.  The tacos were very tasty and the drinks were good, I will certainly go back.
Our server Mimi was kind and helpful .. rooftop is a vibe.. Food was delicious. Would come back if I stayed in Atlanta..

Me and my friend decided to come
Try out this Mexican restaurant in Atlantic Station and let me tell you the manager Don was amazing. He has the best customer service and made us feel right at home. He as well as his comrades did an amazing job at ensuring we were comfortable and received everything necessary. Definitely enjoyed the guac and queso. Will be returning. 5 Star Service and Food. Try them out

I came here one night with my boyfriend after seeing this place on instagram. I wanted so bad to like it but service was horrible (I sat at the upstairs bar) as the bartender was completely aloof and had no idea on how to man a bar. My boyfriend waited 20 minutes for his first drink. We literally watched her make drinks for people who had sat down after us bc she didn't want to go downstairs and get another bottle of makers mark. Not to mention the bartender was serving one customer who was clearly drunk that she should've cut off. To make it worst, the rice in my bowl was soggy. How do you mess up rice at a Mexican restaurant ? The cheese dip was good so at least I can say that. Unfortunately, I will never be back. Horrible experience. For food vlogs, follow @theboogiefoodie

photos.caption: Some bowl I got with overcooked rice

comment.text:
I've been seeing azotea EVERYWHERE and I'm so glad I was finally able to go! Azotea's website provides directions to get to the restaurant, so make sure you check before you go so you don't get lost in Atlantic station. 

Theres plenty of seating downstairs, upstairs, and outside on the rooftop, but it gets pretty busy so reservations are definitely encouraged. We started with the salsa trio which had a super interesting pumpkin salsa, a generic red salsa, a generic salsa verde, and homemade chips. 

I then had tacos for my main course and ended the night with churros. The tacos were small, but they were absolutely PACKED with delicious toppings. The churros were also amazing and I loved the chocolate dipping sauce that came with them.

Azotea is a must try taco place in atlanta, and it'll definitely be an addition to my list of favorite restaurants!
Sat for 35 mins no silverware. Requested utensils had to wait another 20 mins. Fries were limp and soaked in oil. The food is not good. I won't be return

Love this place! Great location with easy garage parking. The restaurant has a nice rooftop that's spacious and has music on the weekends. The staff is friendly and very accommodating. The drinks are awesome! I love a spicy margarita! The tacos were good and the queso appetizer is a MUST! I'll definitely be coming back here.

I frequent Atlantic Station, but surprisingly enough this was my first visit to Azotea Cantina.

This is a cute and trendy spot...great addition to Atlantic Station. Hubby & I was seated immediately upon entering.  

PROS
Service- Our server Frederick was pleasant and on point.

Food - The salsa trio we ordered as a starter was a real treat. 
I ordered shrimp tacos & hubby ordered Baja fish tacos....both were pretty good 

Cocktail - Escalade lived up to it's name (delicious)

Prices: No complaints

Music: Great 

CONS
Not one

I look forward to returning on a beautiful spring afternoon and dine on the rooftop.

Wow, this place was so incredibly good! NOBODY in my party had 1 negative thing to say. I give 10s all across the board, gorgeous view & location, good food, and good food presentation. Fast service. The Guac is so good! (free refill on chips) Best i've ever had honestly. I will definitely be returning to enjoy the rooftop experience

photos.caption: In front of building, fun activities

comment.text:
If your looking for a cool roof-top vibe this is the place to be. Upstair has an indoor/outdoor setup. The bar is inside, some dinning table are inside others are located outside on the roof-top near the DJ booth. I know for sure they  have a DJ on Saturdays. The restaurant gets super busy so your best bet is to go early or make a reservation. 
The bar scene on the first floor is trendy and chic. Great place to mingle and meet new people. 
This restaurant is located in Atlantic Station. It replaced the other Mexican restaurant that used to be there.

Very Disappointed with Our Visit. We had a large Group and wanted to sit on the roof the people upstairs servers had such an attitude, (bartenders were good and polite) but the servers acted as if they were doing us a favor 
In total there were about 10-12 people in our group and I spent well over $1k on drinks alone I have no issue with the prices I just want to state that we spent money and ordered plenty of drinks which were  ok but the service was horrible, slow and just unprofessional, rude !!! Good luck we should have just gone somewhere else I was embarrassed I invited our out of town guest to meet us there . Step it up Azotea Cantina Service is lousy slow unprofessional and remember you aren't doing me a favor by bring me my drink !!!  I personally have no need to ever return to this place there are plenty of restaurants with better food drinks and Especially Service !!

I have been looking at reviews on this restaurant ever since they opened. Where to star.....the ambiance is great with the garage doors, music and location. We had the carbs asada tacos....spicy but amazing; Baja fish tacos....the cabbage slaw on top really complements the fish; the rice and beans were my favorite.....not sure what kind of beans they were but the flavors were great and matched well with the tacos; the guacamole with cojiti cheese and pork belly (odd but why not) was really good. 

The staff.......as soon as we walked in a waitress was standing at the hostess booth looking like today was not her day. She, roamed the restaurant no smile, servers were standing around, the only who greeted us was our main server. It took her a minute to greet us but was very nice. I would love to give this a 4.5 but with the restaurant in a centrally tourist location, customer service is key. 

Yes I will come back and hope the service is better.

photos.caption: Carne Asada tacos, Baja Fish Tacos, Guacamole with pork belly and cojito cheese.

comment.text: Great service here! The waitress came around frequently (but not too frequently) to check and make sure we were taken care of. We ordered the Shrimp Tacos and Carne Asada Tacos and both were delicious but the shrimp really stole the show! We also ordered a few drinks and had a great time!

Honestly exceeded my expectations!! I was very surprised with how good this place was. The chips were SO good and not really greasy at all - I loved the salsa trio!! I also got the chicken tacos which were really good! I was very happy overall and our server was so friendly throughout :) 
Also - highly recommend getting a frozen marg here!

10/10. I came here once over a year ago and remembered how tasty these tacos were so I had to come back and they taste even better than I remember. Texture and flavor wise, the combination of the cauliflower, garlic aioli, sweet potatoes, cilantro, lime and corn tortillas made an excellent combination for a party of flavors. The mocktail was so yummy and tasted like a orange creamsicle drink. The owner of the establishment visited my table and had a very funny since of humor and lovely southern hospitality. The bartender/server was very nice and attentive as well. My friend had the fish tacos and the way she raved over them, I will be trying those next. The rooftop ambiance is beautiful and spacious.
Ambiance was amazing, food was delicious and great service! Jarah our server was fantastic!

Literally the best taco spot in Atlanta and I work in a Mexican restaurant! Donavon is definitely the highlight of this experience, mostly likely a main reason I'll come back, the service here is top tier!!!

I recently had the pleasure of dining at Azotea Cantina in Atlantic Station and the experience was nothing short of amazing! From the moment we walked in, the ambiance was lively and welcoming, a true testament to the vibrant culture the restaurant emulates. 

Our server, Kalia, was an absolute delight. She was knowledgeable, friendly, and had a knack for making spot-on recommendations which made our culinary journey through the menu a memorable one. Her service was attentive without being intrusive, striking the perfect balance that made our meal enjoyable.

A special shoutout to Donovan and the chef, who are the managers at Azotea. They made a point to check on us, ensuring that everything was to our liking. Their professionalism and personable nature added a special touch to the evening. The chef's expertise was apparent in the delectable dishes we savored - each bite was a burst of flavor that had us yearning for more.

The team at Azotea Cantina, especially Kalia, Donovan, and the chef, truly know how to provide an exceptional dining experience. Their attention to detail, warm hospitality, and culinary prowess make this place a gem in Atlantic Station. I can't wait for my next visit!

If I could give this place zero stars, I would. As soon as this place opened, I couldn't wait to try it and seat on the rooftop. Even though a friend told me the food wasn't good, I wanted to see for myself. But I should have listened. After being sat, we ordered flavored margaritas and they really good. For apps, we ordered queso, which was extremely watery and guacamole which had no ounce of flavor at all. I never like asking a server to take food back and remove it from the bill, but they were both just nasty. Then the tacos came to the table, just the presentation alone was a sign for disaster. The shrimp was bland and there were no condiments on it but cheese and old cilantro. I highly recommend NOT dining in here, unless you want a drink only.

Great new place in Atlantic station! They claim not to be tex mex but more modern Mexican food and I have to agree! Their take on ahi tuna nachos was so tasty and their guacamole dip could be eaten with a spoon. For my order I got the Tostad de Ahi Tuna. It's sushi grade tuna, avocado, and morita aioli served on a tostada. At first I was afraid it wasn't enough (I eat a lot) but after three and all of the guac I downed I was stuffed! I may have also snuck a couple of bites of my wife's taco and let me tell you for a person that doesn't eat steak EVER..this thing was on point. The Bistec Alamore has grilled ribeye, onions, queso, crispy bacon and topped with papa fritas (French fries)! SAY WHAT!? The server was also very professional and made sure all of our needs were met. Oh did I mention the rooftop bar???? Adults only though! The only reason I'm not going to five stars is their bus boy decided he needed to sweep under our table while we were eating...even hit my foot with the broom. I'll be going back though!

The place is cute and the drinks are good! Anyway, my food was pretty BAD. I had the fish tacos and they were so greasy like grease dripping down the side of my mouth greasy. Then I order the Brussel sprouts and had the same problem, they were so greasy! Bartender was great on point and offered me something else but I declined.

the service is 10/10. The staff is amazing. The food is amazing aswell. Me and my family tore the queso dip up! The ambiance was overall fantastic! Very friendly environment with a great view! I recommend this place for everyone

Decent place, was quite busy and took a while to be greeted once we entered and stood near the host stand. We chose to go upstairs to the adult bar and sat at a table near the bar.  No one came to help us for a while so my friend got up and went to the bar to ask.  Finally someone came over and we placed the order for drinks and food.  The drinks, the tacos and the guacamole were ok...good but nothing stood out.  The guacamole lacked flavor...just tasted like a mashed up avocado.

Pros: beautiful rooftop and rooftop bar. The salad I got was really good. The drink was strong and tasted amazing! My server was very helpful with the menu. 

Cons: I had to wait about 10-15 minutes for a server to approach my table to take my order

photos.caption: Salad with shrimp and jalapeo margarita drink

comment.text:
Amazing Experience at this restaurant!! 

Service A+ Waitress Louisa was amazing !! Very informative and very nice!! 

Food was amazing!! My wife and I enjoyed everything we ordered!! 

Vibes A+ !! We sat on the rooftop!! Great views and music 

We frequent Atlantic Station and Azotea will definitely be our top choice when it comes to a dining experience!!

Really good food!! I'm not sure if management was changed but this such an upgrade to what was served before ! The device was excellent they went above and beyond to accommodate myself and my infant and car seat. They were welcoming and now to the main event !! The food !! Everything is so fresh and came out in a great TT( time & temperature ) all the tacos were great If I had to choose the po
Decent meal for somewhat inexpensive. Our waitress was friendly and the food was good.

Muy bueno!

I had the bowl option and it was simply delicious. Alot of food too! Rice was perfect, the grilled shrimp was delicious and didn't need anything - which is hard to accomplish. The grilled pineapple is an interesting ingredient but worked well with the pinto beans. I highly recommend! 

Josh was my waiter and he was an asbolute great example of what customer service is!
